To verify if a store in the Philippines needs to include VAT in the total price, you can check if the store is VAT-registered with the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR). Businesses that are VAT-registered are required to include VAT in their invoices and charge it to customers, while businesses that are not VAT-registered are not required to do so.

One way to check if a store is VAT-registered is to look for the TIN (Tax Identification Number) on the store's official receipts or invoices. All VAT-registered businesses are required to have a TIN and it should be indicated on their official receipts or invoices.

Another way to check is to ask the store directly if they are VAT-registered and if they charge VAT on their sales.

Additionally, you can check the BIR's website for a list of VAT-registered businesses, but please note that this list may not be up-to-date and it's always good to ask the store directly.

It's also good to note that even if the store is not VAT-registered, they may still include VAT on their prices and it's good to check the prices and ask the store if they are VAT-registered and if they charge VAT on their sales.
